### scheduledNode() {#a93f241795b5da8c207a88063862e2ea2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LatencyPriorityQueue::scheduledNode (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
As each node is scheduled, this method is invoked.

This allows the priority function to adjust the priority of related unscheduled nodes, for example.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-h/#l00094">94</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-h">LatencyPriorityQueue.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-cpp/#l00089">89</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-cpp">LatencyPriorityQueue.cpp</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Private Member Functions

### AdjustPriorityOfUnscheduledPreds() {#a3b3546461826ffbb709ae7887783833d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LatencyPriorityQueue::AdjustPriorityOfUnscheduledPreds (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; SU)</>}>
AdjustPriorityOfUnscheduledPreds - One of the predecessors of SU was just scheduled.

If SU is not itself available, then there is at least one predecessor node that has not been scheduled yet. If SU has exactly ONE unscheduled predecessor, we want to increase its priority: it getting scheduled will make this node available, so it is better than some other node of the same priority that will not make a node available.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-h/#l00097">97</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-h">LatencyPriorityQueue.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-cpp/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-cpp">LatencyPriorityQueue.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getSingleUnscheduledPred() {#a50147b83acc2b96cf706634303451838}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SUnit &#42; LatencyPriorityQueue::getSingleUnscheduledPred (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; SU)</>}>
getSingleUnscheduledPred - If there is exactly one unscheduled predecessor of SU, return it, otherwise return null.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-h/#l00098">98</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-h">LatencyPriorityQueue.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-cpp/#l00056">56</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-cpp">LatencyPriorityQueue.cpp</a>.

## Private Member Attributes

### NumNodesSolelyBlocking {#ae06f53374d3bb728a50986cfe66958d8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt;unsigned&gt; llvm::LatencyPriorityQueue::NumNodesSolelyBlocking</>}>
NumNodesSolelyBlocking - This vector contains, for every node in the Queue, the number of nodes that the node is the sole unscheduled predecessor for.

This is used as a tie-breaker heuristic for better mobility.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-h/#l00040">40</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/latencypriorityqueue-h">LatencyPriorityQueue.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
